abstract.text: Resolves the intended status of the task.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The intent object containing details about the user’s request. Use this object to get the initial information, if any, provided by the user.

The handler block to execute with the resolution. You must execute this handler at some point during your implementation of this method. This handler has no return value and takes the following parameter:
The object containing the details of your proposed resolution. For successful resolutions, create a resolution object with the
value that you intend to assign to the task.

Implement this method to resolve the task’s intended status. In most cases, you return a successful resolution with the requested status. In the event that you cannot change the status to the requested value, return a successful result from this method and use your confirmation method to report the failure.

abstract.text: Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
A request to modify the attributes of a task.
The handler interface for updating the attributes of an existing task.
Resolves the intended priority of the task.
Resolves the location-based trigger to apply to the task.
Resolves the intended status of the task.
Resolves which task the user wants to modify.
Resolves the intended title of the task.
Resolves the time-based trigger to apply to the task.
Resolves the time-based trigger to apply to the task.
Constants indicating the completion state of a task.
A resolution result for the status of a task.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.

value that you intend to assign to the task.
